com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExceptionHandlers.DefaultExceptionHandler
    Enclosing class:
    ExceptionHandlers

    public static class ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
    A simple implementation of ExceptionHandlers.ExceptionHandler which pops-up error dialog boxes and toasts.

    The labels of the dialogs and the toasts are i18ned though the provided SmartApplication.I18N provided instance.

    Since:
    2009.07.09

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler.ConnectivityUIExperience
      Defines how the framework should behave when an Internet connectivity problem has been detected.

      • ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler(SmartApplication.I18N i18n,
                                          ActivityController.IssueAnalyzer issueAnalyzer)
        Parameters:
        i18n - will be used at runtime, so as to display i18ned labels in the UI
        issueAnalyzer - will be used when it comes to analyze an issue represented by an Throwable

    • Method Detail

      • onBusinessObjectAvailableException

        public final boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableException(android.app.Activity activity,
                                         java.lang.Object component,
                                         LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
        Description copied from interface: ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Is invoked whenever the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() throws an exception.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Specified by:
        onBusinessObjectAvailableException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that issued the exception, and which is ensured not to be finishing ; cannot be null
        component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
        exception - the exception that has been thrown
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

      • onActivityException

        public final boolean onActivityException(android.app.Activity activity,
                          java.lang.Object component,
                          java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Description copied from interface: ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Is invoked whenever an activity implementing LifeCycle throws an unexpected exception outside from the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Specified by:
        onActivityException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that issued the exception ; cannot be null
        component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

      • onContextException

        public final boolean onContextException(boolean isRecoverable,
                         android.content.Context context,
                         java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown with a non-Activity / Fragment context.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Specified by:
        onContextException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        context - the context that issued the exception
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore
        See Also:
        onContextExceptionFallback(boolean, Context, Throwable)

      • onException

        public final boolean onException(boolean isRecoverable,
                  java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown outside from an available context.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Specified by:
        onException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore
        See Also:
        onExceptionFallback(boolean, Throwable)

      • onBusinessObjectAvailableExceptionFallback

        protected boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableExceptionFallback(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                 java.lang.Object component,
                                                 LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
        This method will be invoked by the #onBusinessObjectAvailableException() method, as a fallback if the provided exception has not been handled neither by the #handleCommonCauses() nor the #handleOtherCauses() methods.

        A dialog box which reports the problem will be popped up by the current implementation: when the end-user acknowledges the issue reported by the dialog box, the Activity will be finished.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity from which the exception has been thrown ; cannot be null
        component - the component responsible for having thrown the exception
        throwable - the exception that has been thrown
        Returns:
        true if and only if the exception has been handled
        See Also:
        #onBusinessObjectAvailableException()

      • onActivityExceptionFallback

        protected boolean onActivityExceptionFallback(android.app.Activity activity,
                                  java.lang.Object component,
                                  java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        This method will be invoked by the #onActivityException() method, as a fallback if the provided exception has not been handled neither by the #handleCommonCauses() nor the #handleOtherCauses() methods.

        A dialog box which reports the problem will be popped up by the current implementation: when the end-user acknowledges the issue reported by the dialog box, the Activity will be finished.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity from which the exception has been thrown ; cannot be null
        component - the component responsible for having thrown the exception
        throwable - the exception that has been thrown
        Returns:
        true if and only if the exception has been handled
        See Also:
        #onActivityException()

                                 java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        This method will be invoked by the #onContextException()() method, as a fallback if the provided exception has not been handled neither by the #handleCommonCauses() method.
        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        context - the context that issued the exception
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:

      • onExceptionFallback

        protected boolean onExceptionFallback(boolean isRecoverable,
                          java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        This method will be invoked by the #onException()() method, as a fallback if the provided exception has not been handled neither by the #handleCommonCauses() method.
        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • handleCommonCauses

        protected final boolean handleCommonCauses(android.app.Activity activity,
                         java.lang.Object component,
                         java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                         ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler.ConnectivityUIExperience connectivityUIExperience)
        Checks for an Internet connectivity issue or a memory saturation issue inside the provided exception root causes.

        This method is especially useful when overriding the ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler, in order to let the framework hunt for common troubles.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which has triggered the exception; may be null
        component - the component which has triggered the exception ; may be null
        throwable - the exception to analyze
        connectivityUIExperience - indicates what end-user experience to deliver if the problem is an Internet connectivity issue ; may be null
        Returns:
        true if and only if the exception has been handled
        See Also:
        #handleConnectivityProblemInCause(Activity, Throwable, ConnectivityUIExperience), #handleMemoryProblemInCause(Activity, Throwable)

      • submitToIssueAnalyzer

        protected final void submitToIssueAnalyzer(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        If an ActivityController.IssueAnalyzer is registered, this will invoke the IssueAnalyzer#handleIssue() method.
        Parameters:
        throwable - the exception that has previously been thrown

      • showDialog

        protected final void showDialog(android.app.Activity activity,
              java.lang.CharSequence dialogTitle,
              java.lang.CharSequence dialogMessage,
              java.lang.CharSequence positiveButton,
              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener positiveClickListener,
              java.lang.CharSequence negativeButton,
              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener negativeClickListener,
              android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener onCancelListener)
        The method which should be invoked internally when reporting an error dialog box. The parameters are the same as for the #onShowDialog() method.

        It is possible to invoke that method from any thread.

        See Also:
        #onShowDialog()

      • handleOtherCauses

        protected boolean handleOtherCauses(android.app.Activity activity,
                        java.lang.Object component,
                        java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        A place holder for handling in a centralized way all kinds of exceptions.

        When deriving from the ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler class, this method should be overridden, so as to handle all application specific exceptions.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which has triggered the exception
        component - the component which has triggered the exception ; may be null
        throwable - the exception to analyze
        Returns:
        true if and only if the exception has been handled; the current implementation returns false

      • handleConnectivityProblemInCause

        protected boolean handleConnectivityProblemInCause(android.app.Activity activity,
                                       java.lang.Object component,
                                       java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                                       ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler.ConnectivityUIExperience connectivityUIExperience)
        Is invoked when a connectivity issue has been detected, and display a dialog box if any.

        If such Internet connectivity issue is detected, a Toast will be displayed if the connectivityUIExperience parameter is set to ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler.ConnectivityUIExperience.Toast ; otherwise, a dialog box will be popped up: if the end-user does not hit the button which proposes to retry, the Activity will be finished.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which has triggered the exception ; may be null, and in that case, the hereby implementation does nothing
        component - the component which has triggered the exception ; may be null
        throwable - the exception which is supposed to be related to an Internet issue
        connectivityUIExperience - indicates the end-user experience to provide if a connectivity problem has been detected
        Returns:
        true if and only a connection issue has been detected

      • handleMemoryProblemInCause

        protected boolean handleMemoryProblemInCause(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked when a memory saturation issue has been detected, and display a dialog box if any.

        In the exception root cause is a memory saturation issue, a @{link .hprof} dump file will be generated into the directory Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory(), and the exact name of this file will be traced.

        Parameters:
        throwable - the exception which is supposed to be related to an out-of-memory
        Returns:
        true if and only a memory saturation issue has been detected
        See Also:
        ActivityController.IssueAnalyzer.handleIssue(Throwable)

      • onShowDialog

        protected void onShowDialog(android.app.Activity activity,
                java.lang.CharSequence dialogTitle,
                java.lang.CharSequence dialogMessage,
                java.lang.CharSequence positiveButton,
                android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener positiveClickListener,
                java.lang.CharSequence negativeButton,
                android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener negativeClickListener,
                android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener onCancelListener)
        Is responsible for displaying a dialog box. This enables to customize in a centralized way the dialog boxes look & feel.

        It is ensured that the framework will invoke that method from the UI thread, and when invoking that method directly, this must be done from the UI thread as well.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which is bound to pop up the dialog box
        dialogTitle - the dialog box title
        dialogMessage - the dialog box message
        positiveButton - the label to display for the dialog box positive button ; may be null if positiveClickListener is also null
        positiveClickListener - the callback which will be invoked from the UI thread when the end-user hits the positive button
        negativeButton - the label to display for the dialog box positive button ; may be null if negativeClickListener is also null
        negativeClickListener - the callback which will be invoked from the UI thread when the end-user hits the negative button ; may be null, and in that case, the "No" button is hidden
        onCancelListener - the callback which will be invoked from the UI thread when the end-user hits the "back" button ; may be null, and in that case, the dialog box will not be cancelleable
        See Also:
        #showDialog()
